introductionText.paragraph1: Hello, my name is Ian Chaya.
introductionText.paragraph2: I am 27 years old, I was born in Argentina but I also have Croatian nationality.
introductionText.paragraph3: I am an Electronic Engineer, Diploma in Digital Transformation and Industries 4.0 and Front-end Developer.
introductionText.paragraph4: I have experience in Automation, Embedded Systems Programming, Electronic Circuit Design, Signal Processing and Front-end Web Development.
introductionText.paragraph5: I am a proactive and enthusiastic person. I like to work in a team and I adapt quickly to changes.
introductionText.paragraph6: I am currently a member of the Automation and Test Engineering team at BGH SA

educations.title: Scrum Master - Agile methodologies
educations.description: Application of techniques based on agile methodologies - Review and explanation of the agile manifesto - When to apply an agile methodology? - Formation of customer-team commitment. - How to apply an agile methodology? - Documentation. Transparency and Collaboration. - Alignment of SCRUM to the principles of agile methodologies. - Tour of different frameworks. - What are the roles in a SCRUM team? - Articulation of roles with the principles of collaboration and transparency of agile methodologies - Configuration and prioritization of the repository of requirements. - MoSCoW method. - Workflows. - Negotiation of the concept of fact. - Alignment of the workflow to the concept of fact. - What are the meetings? - Who participates in the meetings? - What objectives are pursued in the meetings? - Meetings: User Story Refinement meeting, Planning meeting, Daily meetings, Product Review meeting (Demo), Retrospective meeting. - Planning work iterations. - Application of the workflow to the committed requirements. - Progress tracking. - Iteration tracking metrics. Iteration closure metrics. - Cumulative metrics. - Speed and capacity of equipment as incident variables in the iteration.

Directional, flow, pressure, blocking and closing valves. internal constitution. Symbology according to ISO 1219 standard. Composite valves. Pneumatic timers. Practical theoretical resolution of sequential circuits. Assembly of pneumatic circuits.

projects.title: Installation of Collaborative Robot to manipulate Transformers
projects.description: In a Microwave Oven production line, one of the positions is dedicated to the Assembly and Fixing of Transformers. In this position, the operator moves a transformer from the corresponding Pallet to a Bolting Support. This transformer weighs between 3.5Kg and 5Kg, and in order to place it on the support the operator has to make a 90Â° turn, which is not recommended ergonomically speaking. In order to prevent injuries to the operator, a Collaborative Robot (Cobot) was added to the workplace to help the operator with repetitive tasks and lifting Heavy Loads. Using a camera that performs image processing, the robot detects the transformer on the pallet and reaches it to the screw support. To carry out the project, it was necessary to budget the project, re-design the job, program the collaborative robot, model in 3D and make the additional clamp that lifts the transformer, program the camera that detects the transformer, make the button panel for handling of the cobot together with its electronics and installing the collaborative robot with its respective follow-up until it works correctly. This was a team effort that was carried out in conjunction with all areas of the Company (Automation and Test Engineering, Process Engineering, Production, Logistics, Medical Service, Safety and Hygiene, and operators).
projects.place: Rio Grande, Tierra del Fuego, Argentina

projects.title: Tube Amplifier Simulator using Raspberry Pi
projects.description: Theory of operation of tube amplifiers. - Study of their characteristic stages, their corresponding circuits and their frequency response with a view to their subsequent digitization and use in real time - Theory of operation and frequency response of sound effects (delay, flanger, distortion) and their electronic circuits for their subsequent digitization and use in real time - Change of analog electronic circuits to their digital equivalent using numerical methods - Processing of analog signals - Execution of numerical methods in Matlab for testing - Execution of numerical methods in C language - Execution of code programmed in Pure Data software using custom libraries - Real-time software application using Raspberry Pi and Pi Sound - Real-time graphical interface of the set - Sound effects and tube amps - Testing each stage of tube amps, sound effects and both parties working together. - Comparison and contrast of the analog frequency response versus the digital frequency response - Preparation of a final report with applied theory, codes, written essays, final conclusions and improvements to be made.

projects.title: Simulation of Sunlight with high power LEDs for testing solar panels
projects.description: Theory of the spectrum of sunlight - Theory of the operation of solar panels. - Theory of LED technology - Choice of LEDs to obtain maximum power from the solar panel - Choice of energy source - Choice of components according to the requirements to be met, creation of a list with price and quantity, ordering of components - Design and plate printing and component soldering - Light intensity control by means of a PWM generated with an STM32 microcontroller programmed in C language - Graphical interface sending data through the serial port of the microcontroller. - Test of the electronic board with the microcontroller to obtain the maximum power in the solar panel - Teamwork with two students of different nationalities, who speak English and French. - Final report on the work carried out, the drawbacks and the main conclusions

projects.title: Home automation with Raspberry Pi and Arduino
projects.description: Control of lights in different parts of a house, fans, pool pumps and temperature measurement through a web page accessible from any device (PC, smartphone, tablet) - Use of Raspberry Pi as server - Use of Arduino as slave - Programming in NodeRed language for the creation of the graphical interface - Assembly of the electronic circuit and use of the DHT11 temperature sensor - Sending data through the serial port of the Raspberry Pi to Arduino to establish communication with the keyboard - Final report showing results , disadvantages and conclusions
